snippet: The journey of “Levitated Mass” followed a circuitous route through four counties and 22 cities, took 11 days and ended at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.
abstract: Boulder turned artwork titled Levitated Mass--340 tons and 21 feet high--travels 11 days and 60 miles from a quarry through four southern California counties and 22 cities to its final destination at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.
lead_paragraph: The journey of “Levitated Mass” followed a circuitous route through four counties and 22 cities, took 11 days and ended at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

headline.seo: 340-Ton Artwork Arrives at Los Angeles County Museum of Art
headline.main: Lights! Cameras! (and Cheers) for a Rock Weighing 340 Tons
headline.print_headline: Cameras and Tears for New Star Of Los Angeles: 340-Ton Rock

keywords.value: Los Angeles County Museum of Art
